CommunicationProtocol

Class ClientProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • CommunicationProtocol.ClientProtocol

  • public class ClientProtocol
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the client protocol used to exchange messages with the server.
    Author:
    a.ortizg@uniandes.edu.co, lp.cardozo@uniandes.edu.co

    • Method Detail

      • process

        public static void process(java.io.BufferedReader stdIn,
                           java.io.BufferedReader pIn,
                           java.io.PrintWriter pOut)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                           java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                           org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException
        The main client method to process the protocol.
        Parameters:
        stdIn - the standard console input from the user
        pIn - the input buffer to the client from the server
        pOut - the output sent from the client
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an I/O error.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - when a particular cryptographic algorithm is requested but is not available in the environment.
        org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException - when there is a BouncyCastle exception.
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - when there is a problem with the certificate.

      • SYN

        private static void SYN()
        Sends the synchronize message to the server.

                     throws java.io.IOException
        Handles the acknowledgement from the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an I/O error.

      • ACK

        private static void ACK()
        Sends the acknowledge message to the server.

      • accepted

        private static boolean accepted()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Checks if the algorithm acknowledge string was accepted.
        Returns:
        true if the server accepted the string. False otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an I/O error.

      • generateCertificate

        private static java.security.cert.X509Certificate generateCertificate(java.security.KeyPair keyPair)
                                                               throws org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException,
                                                                      java.security.cert.CertificateException
        Returns an X509 certificate.
        Parameters:
        keyPair - the asymmetric key pair used to build the certificate
        Returns:
        the X509 certificate
        Throws:
        org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException - when there is a BouncyCastle exception.
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - when there is an error with a certificate.

      • generateAsymmetricKeyPair

        private static java.security.KeyPair generateAsymmetricKeyPair()
                                                        throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Generates the asymmetric key pair that will be used to create the certificate.
        Returns:
        the 1024-bit keypair
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - when the algorithm that is requested isn't in the environment.

      • sendCertificate

        public static void sendCertificate(java.security.cert.X509Certificate pCertificate)
                            throws java.security.cert.CertificateEncodingException
        Converts the X509 certificate to a string and sends it to the server.
        Parameters:
        pCertificate - the client's X509 certificate
        Throws:
        java.security.cert.CertificateEncodingException - when there is an error with the certificate.

      • receiveCertificate

        private static java.security.cert.X509Certificate receiveCertificate()
                                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the server's X509 certificate.
        Returns:
        the X509 certificate.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an error with an I/O operation.

      • decipherSecretKeyFromServer

        public static byte[] decipherSecretKeyFromServer(java.security.KeyPair pKeyPair)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Deciphers the secret key from the server using RSA and returns its byte representation.
        Parameters:
        pKeyPair - the server's key pair containing its public and private keys
        Returns:
        the byte representation of the secret key
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an error with an I/O operation.

      • decipherChallengeFromServer

        public static byte[] decipherChallengeFromServer(byte[] pServerClientKeyBytes)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Deciphers the challenge from the server using AES and returns its byte representation.
        Parameters:
        pServerClientKeyBytes - the secret key between sever/client
        Returns:
        the byte representation of the deciphered challenge
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is an error with an I/O operation.

      • getServerPublicKey

        private static java.security.PublicKey getServerPublicKey(java.security.cert.X509Certificate pServerCertificate)
        Returns the server's public key.
        Parameters:
        pServerCertificate - the server's certificate.
        Returns:
        the server's public key

      • sendChallengeToServer

        private static void sendChallengeToServer(java.security.PublicKey pServerKey,
                                          byte[] pChallengeBytes)
        Sends the challenge to the server using RSA.
        Parameters:
        pServerKey - the server's pubic key.
        pChallengeBytes - the byte representation of the deciphered challenge
